newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian bond spreads edge in vs US, Canada.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian bond spreads edge in vs US, Canada.

text.p: The Australian/U.S. 10-year bond yield spread narrowed slightly on Friday and was sharply down on the week, traders said.

The margin was again testing the 125 basis points level seen earlier this week which followed the positive response to the 1996/97 budget statement and Standard & Poor's revised outlook on Australia to positive.
However, local action was fairly light as the market wound down ahead of the weekend and after a busy trading week.
The 10-year spread to Canada was also tighter, despite the long-end rally there on Thursday after the Bank of Canada shaved 25 basis points off its key Bank Rate to 4.25 percent.
However, New Zealand continued to outpace the local market on the back of recent Eurokiwi bond issues and on the possibility of more to come, traders added.
